problem_text:
Largely because of riding in cars, you are used to horizontal circular motion. Vertical circular motion would be a novelty. In this sample problem, such motion seems to defy the gravitational force.

In a 1901 circus performance, Allo "Dare Devil" Diavolo introduced the stunt of riding a bicycle in a loopthe-loop (Figure). Assuming that the loop is a circle with radius $R=2.7 \mathrm{~m}$, what is the least speed $v$ that Diavolo and his bicycle could have at the top of the loop to remain in contact with it there?
